intro: Chimarrhis paraensis, commonly known as the Paraense Flame Tree, is a striking plant native to the Amazon rainforest of Brazil. It is characterized by its large, showy, red-orange flowers that bloom in clusters, creating a dramatic visual impact. The plant belongs to the Bignoniaceae family, which includes many ornamental and woody species. Chimarrhis paraensis typically grows as a tall tree or shrub, reaching heights of up to 10 meters. Its rapid growth and vibrant floral display make it a popular choice for ornamental planting in tropical regions.
